caption: This photograph depicts a scene of destruction, possibly following a demolition or disaster. The image is dominated by a large pile of debris, which includes broken bricks, wooden planks, and other unidentifiable rubble. Prominently jutting up from this wreckage is a surviving doorframe, still mostly intact but devoid of its door, creating a poignant symbol amidst the chaos. This doorframe stands lean and oddly solemn against a background of dense, leafy green trees and a slightly overcast sky, hinting at a rural or semi-rural setting. The ground around the debris pile is covered in grass and small shrubs, indicating that the site has been left untouched for a period allowing vegetation to grow. The lighting suggests it might be either early morning or late afternoon, adding a moody atmosphere to the scene. The overall impression is one of melancholy and abandonment.
title: Doorway to nowhere - all that remains of a Mulky Square house that stood in the path of a new expressway (Interstate 635)
